Module hunterkehler.inventorymanager
Package hunterkehler.inventorymanager

Class ModifyPartController

java.lang.Object
hunterkehler.inventorymanager.ModifyPartController
public class ModifyPartController extends Object
This Java class handles all ButtonEvents such as adding switching between InHouse and Outsourced, updating the modified Part, exiting to the Main Menu, and catching errors when entering data for the Part

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type

    Description
    (package private) int
    partIndex
    An integer used to keep track of the index used by the modified Part

    An integer used to keep track of the ID used by the modified Part

    importData(Part selectedPart, int index)

    onCancelButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Returns to the Main Menu without saving any inputted data

    onInHouseRadioButtonClick()
    Changes the idToggleLabel to Machine ID when the InHouse RadioButton is clicked on
    (package private) void

    Changes the idToggleLabel to Company Name when the Outsourced RadioButton is clicked on
    (package private) void
    onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Checks several errors to make sure the Part is viable for saving, and creates the Part and replaces the original Part with the newly formed Part in the Inventory and returns to the Main Menu

    • importData

      public void importData(Part selectedPart, int index)
      Sets up and fills the blank TextFields with the stats of the original Part
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the Part selected for modification
      index - the index of the Part selected for modification

    • onSaveButtonClick

      void onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Checks several errors to make sure the Part is viable for saving, and creates the Part and replaces the original Part with the newly formed Part in the Inventory and returns to the Main Menu
      Parameters:
      event - button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - FXMLLoader.load() may throw an IOException

    • onCancelButtonClick

      void onCancelButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Returns to the Main Menu without saving any inputted data
      Parameters:
      event - button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - FXMLLoader.load() may throw an IOException
